attributes.additional_details: The British Public have had to endure three years of incompetent negotiations, unconstitutional parliamentary maneuvers, the Speaker breaking with established precedents and remain supporting MPs undermining our negotiating position and whose sole aim has been to stop us leaving the EU and defy the referendum result.
attributes.background: Parliament must be prorogued or dissolved so that we may leave the EU on 31st October 2019 with or without a withdrawal agreement and finally honour the result of the 2016 Referendum. We can then open a new session of Parliament in November with a Queen's speech laying out the government's programme
